title: Fernando Alonso slams long-term rival Lewis Hamilton for vegan 'hypocrisy'

Fernando Alonso has reignited his long-term feud with Lewis Hamilton by slamming the Brit for his controversial views on the enviornment.

Hamilton, who is on the verge of winning a sixth Formula One world title, recently urged his fans to go vegan and said he feels like "giving up on everything".

The 34-year-old, who switched to a plant-based diet in 2017 and in September he helped launch a vegan burger restaurant in London, spelt out his feelings about the state of the world in three posts on Instagram .

But after saying "why bother when the world is such a mess", Alonso - the two-time Formula One world champion - has accused his 2007 McLaren team-mate of being a hypicrite.

(Image: Getty Images)

(Image: Instagram)

"I think I would keep my eating habits to myself," Alonso told Spanish radio station Cope .

"I would never release a message like Lewis. You can't send out a message on one day, and on the next day do the opposite.

"We all know the lifestyle that Lewis has, and that Formula 1 drivers take 200 planes a year. You can't then say 'don't eat meat'."

Hamilton and Alonso endured an intense relationship during their partnership at McLaren, before the latter ultimately quit to return to Renualt.

(Image: Lewis Hamilton/Instagram)

Following his controversial posts, Hamilton later reassured fans that he hasn't "given up".

"Good morning World. I just wanted to send a message of positivity to you, I hope your weeks [sic] been amazing and wishing you a great weekend," he wrote on Instagram.

"I appreciate all the positive vibes you've sent my way. I haven't given up, I'm still right here fighting! #stillirise."

Hamilton will secure a sixth world championship at the Mexican Grand Prix this weekend if he out-scores team-mate Valtteri Bottas by at least 14 points.
description: Lewis Hamilton and Fernando Alonso endured an intense relationship during their McLaren partnership in 2007
